    • Method Detail

      • getLogicalServiceZPath

        public final String getLogicalServiceZPath()
        Description copied from interface: QuorumClient
        The fully qualified identifier of the logical service whose quorum state will be monitored (for zookeeper, this is the logicalServiceZPath). A highly available service is comprised of multiple physical services which are instances of the same logical service.

        Note: The method was renamed from getLogicalServiceId() to QuorumClient.getLogicalServiceZPath() to avoid confusion with the zookeeper integration which has both a logicalServiceId (just the last component of the zpath) and a logicalServiceZPath. The Quorum and QuorumClient interfaces only understand a single logical service identifier - this is what corresponds to the for the zookeeper integration.

        Specified by:
        getLogicalServiceZPath in interface QuorumClient<S extends Remote>
        See Also:
        QuorumMember.getServiceId()

      • getQuorum

        public Quorum<?,?> getQuorum()
        The quorum that is being monitored.

        Specified by:
        getQuorum in interface QuorumClient<S extends Remote>
        Returns:
        The reference from an atomic variable that will be cleared if the quorum terminates.
        See Also:
        QuorumClient.start(Quorum)

      • start

        public void start(Quorum<?,?> quorum)
        Description copied from interface: QuorumClient
        Life cycle message sent when the client will begin to receive messages from the Quorum. At a minimum, the client should save a reference to the Quorum.
        Specified by:

      • disconnected

        public void disconnected()
        The client has become disconnected from the quorum (for zookeeper this is only generated if the session has expired rather than if there is a transient disconnect that can be cured). This callback provides a hook to take any local actions that are required when the client can not longer rely on its role in the quorum state (if the client is disconnected from the quorum, then it is no longer part of the quorum, can not be a joined service, quorum member, etc).

        The default implementation is a NOP.

        Specified by:
        disconnected in interface QuorumClient<S extends Remote>

      • getLeader

        public S getLeader(long token)
        Description copied from interface: QuorumClient
        Return the remote interface used to perform HA operations on the quorum leader.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The remote interface for the leader.

      • getService

        public abstract S getService(UUID serviceId)
        Description copied from interface: QuorumClient

        Returns:

      • notify

        public void notify(QuorumEvent e)
        Description copied from interface: QuorumListener
        Notify the client of a quorum event.

        The listener MUST NOT take any event that could block. In particular, it MUST NOT wait on another thread that will access the Quorum as that will cause a deadlock around the internal lock maintained by the Quorum.

        Specified by:
        notify in interface QuorumListener
